Cyclist Magazine Podcast episode 92: Leigh Timmis is the fastest person to ride across Europe

On the latest episode of the Cyclist Magazine Podcast, Robyn and James are joined by ultra-cyclist Leigh Timmis, the fastest man to cycle across Europe. He pedalled 6,330km from Cabo do Roca in Portugal to Ufa, Russia in just 16 days, 10 hours and 45 minutes.

Timmis also held the record for the further distance cycled in seven days – 3,589km – and has ridden around the world, but that one took a bit longer than usual – about seven years.

He has just released his first book, The Race of Truth, a candid account of sacrifice, inner battles and superhuman efforts as he made his record-breaking ride.

The Race of Truth is published by Summersdale and is available to buy now at all good bookshops, including Waterstones (£10.99).

Our chat begins at 6:42.
